intro: Philippia pallida, commonly known as the pale philippia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Philippia pallida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
